item.title: Who I Am
item.description:
“Our clan originally had the surname ‘Ai.’ During the late Song Dynasty, due to a taboo, we changed ‘Ai’ to ‘Zhong.’” — From the “Zhong Clan Genealogy” of Jiangxi.

Thus, the world lost a person named Ai Liang. “Ai” originally means “compassion” or “sorrow.” Fortunately, I am not someone who sympathizes excessively with the world. The surname change was, after all, done correctly. According to the Shuowen Jiezi, “Zhong” means “close-fitting inner clothing,” which is extended to mean the heart or inner self, symbolizing sincerity and integrity. Unfortunately, it seems I am not someone with pure virtue. Yet, in the end, I still became Zhong Liang. The surname is from my father, and the given name is from my mother.

item.title: Beginnings and Beyond
item.description:
This is my first digital footprint on the web—think of it as me awkwardly waving hello from the edge of cyberspace. Stay tuned as I figure out what I’m doing here (and pretend I’ve always known).

Why I Started This Blog

“Tick,tock,make me creep Never ending counting sheep Never get no sleep”

In short, I haven’t been sleeping well lately. As the saying goes, “He who has no long-term worries must have immediate concerns.” Looking back now, I realize I’ve been worrying about the fact that I have neither—no urgent matters, no grand plans. When a person is well-fed and idle, they tend to look for something to do. So, what to do? Well, why not build a website—a small corner of the web to jot things down as they come?

Where do I stand, and what lies ahead?

I’m sitting in the library of Fenglin Campus at Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics, surrounded by rows upon rows of tidy, orderly desks. Strangely, I don’t find it comforting—it reminds me too much of my high school days. So many people, each with different faces and forms… yet how different are they, really? What I’m doing now, and what I aim to do in the future, is quite simple: to make myself stand apart from the crowd.

Well, That’s Enough for Today

Maybe this post won’t mean much in the long run. But for now, it’s a small step toward clarity, toward something that feels like purpose. I guess that’s enough for today.
